results.title: Si Versailles M'etait Conte = Affairs in Versailles
results.brief_description:
Shot entirely on location at the Chateau de Versailles, ‘Si Versailles…’ tells, Guitry-style, the story of the famous castle - from humble beginings as a hunting pavillion to classic splendour - and of the many events, affairs and gatherings it hosted. This is a typical Guitry production with a stellar cast, dozens of cameos and more one liners and ‘bonts mots’ than a ‘90s sitcom. As usual Guitry makes light of history, mixing major historical events and sexy anecdotes, while playing the central role of Louis XIV. Although it is an historical film, ‘Si Versailles …’ is ladden with anachronisms and factual errors. A share of the profits of the film went to the restoration and upkeep of the castle.

Credits: Producer, Clement Duhour ; director, Sacha Guitry ; writer, Sacha Guitry ; photography, Pierre Montazel ; music, Jean Francaix ; art direction, Rene Renoux.
Cast: Sacha Guitry, Michel Auclair, Jean-Pierre Aumont, Jean-Louis Barrault, Jeanne Boitel, Gilbert Boka, Bourvil, Pauline Carton, Gino Cervi, Jean Chevrier, Aime Clariond, Claudette Colbert, Nicole Courcel, Danielle Delorme, Jean Desailly, Renee Devi

results.title: Fanny and Alexander
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Jorn Donner, Tobis Filmkunst, Personafilm, Gaumont-British Instructional and Cinematograph for Svenska Filminstitutet
results.brief_description: An edited version dubbed in English. Told through the eyes of a small boy, this most personal of Bergman’s works is both autobiographical and an artistic reference point. Set during the turn-of-the century Sweden, the story is about the well-to-do, loving and ebullient Ekdahl family. When the actor-father of 10 year old Alexander and 8 year old Fanny dies, their mother marries a sadistic minister. His cruelty leads Grandmother Eckdahl’s Jewish friend and lover to rescue them. Happiness and balance is restored. Announced as Bergman’s final film, it offers a superlative culmination of his 37 years as one of cinema’s greatest artists. Oscar Winner 1982 for Best Foreign Language Film, Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction and Best Costume Design. Stars Pernilla Allwin, Bertil Guve, Ewa Froling, Jan Malmsjo, Erland Josephson.

results.title: Ma Nuit Chez Maud = My Night with Maud
results.creator_credit: Pierre Cotrell, Barbet Schroeder and Eric Rohmer
results.brief_description:
Jean Louis, a Catholic engineer smug in his acceptance of a Pascalian wager about faith, finds his beliefs challenged by an encounter with Maud, a free-thinking divorcee. She represents desire while Francoise - who he has observed from a distance at Mass - seems to represent, for him, a path to the attainment of grace. The ambiguous conflict between instinct and reason, nature and culture is worked through in this sharply observed comedy of manners, the third of Rohmer’s ‘Moral Tales’ (filmed out of sequence) and set in a wintry Clermont-Ferrand. Although there are many ironic moments, Rohmer’s refusal to displace ambiguity with irony allows space for the viewer to find his/her own way through the thicket created between what is observed and the rationalisation of the narrator. Awards: Prix Georges Melies 1969.

Credits: Producers, Barbet Schroeder, Pierre Cotrell ; director, Eric Rohmer ; writer, Eric Rohmer ; photography, Nestor Almendros ; camera assistant, Philippe Rousselot ; editor, Cecile Decugis.
Cast: Jean-Louis Trintignant, Francoise Fabian, Marie-Christine Barrault, Antoine Vitez.

results.title: Une Vie = a Life
results.brief_description:
Jeanne Dandieu lives with her parents and Rosalie, the maid, in a Normandy mansion. She is rescued from drowning by Julien de la Mare. For Jeanne, it is love at first sight. She introduces him to her parents. A few months later they are engaged to be married. This hurry starts rumours in the village that Julien is only marrying to pay off his debts. Their relationship seems a happy one until the day Jeanne’s parents leave the mansion. Jeanne discovers that her husband is having an affair with Rosalie and that she is pregnant. Jeanne feigns forgiveness, but plans in secret to take her revenge.

Credits: Producers, Annie Dorfmann ; director, Alexandre Astruc ; writers, Roland Laudenbach, Alexandre Astruc ; photography, Claude Renoir ; music, Roman Vlad ; costumes, Mayo, Lucilla.
Cast: Maria Schell, Christian Marquand, Antonella Lualdi, Ivan Desny, Pascale Petit, Marie-Helene Daste, Louis Arbessier, Andree Tainsy, Gerard Darrieu.

results.title: Leningrad Cowboys go America
results.creator_credit: Aki Kaurismaki, Katinka Farago, Klas Oloffson, Svenska filminstitutet and Villealfa Filmproductions
results.brief_description: Somewhere in the wastelands of the Soviet Union lives the worst rock- “rock-‘n”-roll” band in the world; an outfit with no audience and no commercial potential. They decide to bury their national sentiments and go to the United States to try their luck. This film is the riotiously funny account of their journey over the ocean and across the continent; a story of steamy bars and honest folks in the backyards of the Hamburger Nation.

results.title: Pecheur D'islande = Iceland Fisherman (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Pierre Schoendoerffer and Georges de Beauregard
results.brief_description:
Yann, a sailor, is in charge of the ‘Pecheur d’Islande’, a fishing boat said to be jinxed. The boat belongs to Mevel, a rich ship owner whose daughter, Gaud, is in love with Yann. After Gaud’s father becomes bankrupt, Gaud and Yann get married. But their happiness is short-lived. A week after their wedding, Yann goes back to sea while Gaud must struggle to adapt a life of endless waiting. ‘Pecheur d’Islande’ revealed to a vast audience the epic story of the fishing expeditions to the arctic seas.

Credits: Producer, Georges de Beauregard ; director, Pierre Schoendoerffer ; writers, Pierre Schoendoerffer, Andre Tabet ; photography ; Raoul Coutard ; music, Charles Aznavour.
Cast: Jean-Claude Pascal, Juliette Mayhiel, Charles Vanel, Georges Poujouly.

results.title: Industrial symphony no. 1: dream of the broken hearted
results.creator_credit: Elbow Music, David Lynch and Angelo Badalamenti
results.brief_description: Video of a performance featuring Julee Cruise singing the music of David Lynch and Angelo Badalamenti. The theme of the performance is the dreams a woman experiences after the man she loves leaves her. Julee Cruise portrays the woman in her dreams. Also stars Laura Dern and Nicolas Cage.

results.title: Scrooge
results.creator_credit: Ronald Neame, Robert H Solo and Cinema Center Films
results.brief_description: This musical version of Charles Dickens’ timeless and beloved story is a lavish and lively production starring Albert Finney. Ebenezer Scrooge, the miserable old miser, takes a frightening journey through Christmas Past, Present and Yet to Come. He realizes there is still hope for his salvation on Christmas Day. He dons a Father Christmas costume and visits the home of Bob Cratchit, his loyal employee, to spread his new-found joy to the whole family, especially Tiny Tim. Music by Leslie Bricusse.

results.title: White Christmas
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Robert Emmett Dolan and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: White Christmas is a treasury of Irving Berlin classics, among them “Count Your Blessings Instead of Sheep”, “Sisters”, “Blue Skies”, and the beloved holiday song “White Christmas”. Two talented song-and-dance men (Bing Crosby and Danny Kaye) team up after the war. One winter they join forces with a sister act (Rosemary Clooney and Vera-Ellen) and trek to Vermont for a white Christmas. The result is “the stuff dreams are made of”.

results.title: Howard's End
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: From director James Ivory comes the magical and compelling film version of E.M. Forster’s classic novel; beautifully produced and brilliantly acted. The stoical and unyielding Mr. Wilcox (Anthony Hopkins) is part of the rich, ruling class which traditionally stomps on those who are weaker, his repression causes him to lash out at those who are not. The working class Mr. Leonard Baste is a dreamer, imaginative and intelligent, but he is trapped by his class and the ignorance of others. Two sisters, Margaret and Helen Schlegel (Emma Thompson and Helena Bonham-Carter) form a precarious bridge between these two men’s worlds and the result is a compelling and fascinating story about love and betrayal, privilege and poverty, a masterpiece of entertainment. Also stars Vanessa Redgrave, James Wilby and Samuel West.
